block.p: Cassandra Lynn Letvin, the daughter of Karen and Brian Letvin of Sedalia, Colo., is to be married today to Roger Henry Hess, a son of Frances A. Hess of New York and the late Robert L. Hess. Rabbi Audrey S. Pollack is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Emanuel in Denver.

The bride, 29, teaches the first grade at the Hutchinson Elementary School in Lakewood, Colo. She graduated from the University of Colorado and is a candidate for a master's degree in education at Lesley College. Her father, who is retired, taught mathematics at Littleton (Colo.) High School. Her mother, also retired, taught at the Mark Hopkins Elementary School in Littleton.

Cassandra Lynn Letvin, the daughter of Karen and Brian Letvin of Sedalia, Colo., is to be married today to Roger Henry Hess, a son of Frances A. Hess of New York and the late Robert L. Hess. Rabbi Audrey S. Pollack is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Emanuel in Denver.

The bride, 29, teaches the first grade at the Hutchinson Elementary School in Lakewood, Colo. She graduated from the University of Colorado and is a candidate for a master's degree in education at Lesley College. Her father, who is retired, taught mathematics at Littleton (Colo.) High School. Her mother, also retired, taught at the Mark Hopkins Elementary School in Littleton.

The bridegroom, 31, teaches social studies at Arapahoe High School in Littleton. He graduated cum laude from Yale and is a candidate for a master's degree in curriculum and instruction at the University of Denver.

His father was the president of Brooklyn College from 1979 to 1992. The bridegroom's mother is on the boards of Congregation Emanu-El and Hebrew Union College-Jewish Institute of Religion, both in New York.
